workload.fi: Lectures: 24 h. Exercise sessions: 36 h; Independent work: 72 h, Exam: 3 h. Total 135 h [5 cr]
workload.sv: Lectures: 24 h. Exercise sessions: 36 h; Independent work: 72 h, Exam: 3 h. Total 135 h [5 cr]
workload.en: Lectures: 24 h. Exercise sessions: 36 h; Independent work: 72 h, Exam: 3 h. Total 135 h [5 cr]

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija on saanut lisää kokemusta ohjelmoinnista ja ongelmanratkaisusta tietokoneiden avulla. Hän osaa kuvata ohjelmoitavan tietokoneen yleisen rakenteen ja rakentamisen logiikkapiirien avulla. Opiskelija osaa määritellä laskentaresursseja (aika, tila, rinnakkaisuus jne.) ja suhteuttaa niitä tietokoneiden fysikaalisiin rajoituksiin ja mahdollisuuksiin. Hän osaa analysoida ja kuvailla ohjelmien toiminnallisuutta, suorituskykyä ja tarvittavien laskentaresurssien rajoja. Opiskelija ymmärtää, kuinka perustietotyypit esitetään tietokoneessa (tavut, kokonaisluvut, liukuluvut, ...). Hän on myös perehtynyt rekursioon sekä funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin ja rinnakkaislaskennan perusteisiin, ja osaa laatia näitä tekniikoita hyödyntäviä ohjelmia. Opiskelija on tutustunut rajapintojen ja kokoelmatietotyyppien käyttämiseen sekä tuntee ohjelmoinnissa esiintyviä yleisiä haku- ja lajittelutehtäviä. Hän on saanut kokemusta tietokoneohjelmien kuvailemisessa, testaamisessa ja virheiden etsimisestä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avslutad kurs har du fått ytterligare erfarenhet av programmering och förståelse för problemlösning med datorer. Du kommer att kunna beskriva strukturen hos en programmerbar dator och hur den kan byggas upp med hjälp av logiska kretsar. Du kan definiera beräkningsresurser (tid, utrymme, parallellitet, ...) och koppla dessa till datorns fysiska begränsningar och möjligheter. Du kan analysera och förklara funktionaliteten och prestandan hos grundläggande program och uttrycka de beräkningsresurser som behövs i termer av gränsvärden. Du kan förklara hur grundläggande datatyper representeras i en dator (bytes, heltal, flyttal, ...). Du kommer också att ha fått ytterligare kännedom om rekursion, funktionell programmering och grundläggande parallell databehandling. Du kommer att kunna använda dessa tekniker i din egen programmering. Du kan beskriva rollen för gränssnitt och datastrukturer. Du har fått erfarenhet av att felsöka, testa och förklara datorkod. Du är också bekant med grundläggande sök- och sorteringsuppgifter som är vanliga inom programmering.
learningOutcomes.en: After successfully completing the course you have gained further experience in programming and appreciation for problem solving with computers.You will be able to describe the structure of a programmable computer and how it may be built using logic circuits. You can define computational resources (time, space, parallelism, ...) and connect these to the physical limitations and possibilities of the computer. You are able to analyse and explain the functionality and performance of basic programs and express the computational resources needed in terms of bounds. You can explain how basic data types are represented in a computer (bytes, integers, floating point numbers, ...). You will also have gained further familiarity with recursion, functional programming, and basic parallel computing. You will be able to employ these techniques in your own programming. You can describe the role of interfaces and collections. You have gained experience in debugging, testing, and explaining computer code. You are also familiar with basic searching and sorting tasks common in programming.

content.fi: Kokonaislukujen ja liukulukujen binäärimuotoisen esittämisen periaatteet. Bittitason operaatiot. Portit logiikan perusoperaattoreina ja niiden yhdistäminen piirien luomiseksi (esim. yhteenlaskija). Yleinen tietokonearkkitehtuuri porttitasolta korkean tason ohjelmointiin. Yksinkertaisempien funktioiden toteuttaminen assembler-kielellä. Big-O-määritelmä ja laskentaresurssien käsite. Funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin ja rekursion näkökohdat. Yksinkertaiset rinnakkaisohjelmointikonstruktiot. Itsenäinen ohjelmointi, tietojenkäsittelytieteen tuntemus ja ongelmanratkaisu tietokoneiden avulla.
content.sv: Principer för binär representation av heltal och flyttal. Operationer på bitnivå. Grindar som grundläggande logiska operatorer och hur dessa kan kombineras för att skapa kretsar (t.ex. för en adderare). Allmän datorarkitektur från grindnivå till högnivåprogrammering. Implementering av enklare funktioner i assembler. Ordo-definitionen och begreppet beräkningsresurser. Aspekter av funktionell programmering och rekursion. Enkla parallella programmeringskonstruktioner. Självständig programmering, kunskaper i datavetenskap och problemlösning med datorer.
content.en: Principles of binary representation of integers and floating point numbers. Bit-level operations. Gates as basic logic operators and how these can be combined to create circuits (e.g. for an adder). General computer architecture from gate level to high-level programming. Implementation of simpler functions in assembly language. The big-O definition, and concept of computational resources. Aspects of functional programming and recursion. Simple parallel programming constructs. Independent programming, knowledge of computer science, and problem-solving with computers.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: CS-A1111 Ohjelmoinnin peruskiurssi Y1 tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: CS-A1111 Ohjelmoinnin peruskiurssi Y1 eller liknande kurs
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: CS-A1111 or CS-A1113 or similar course

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin käytyään opiskelija tietää erilaisia numeeriseen laskentaan tarkoitettuja ohjelmistoja, tuntee erilaisia tiedon esitys- ja tallennustapoja, käsittää laskennan perusperiaatteet ml. sen rajoitteet ja osaa analysoida ja visualisoida tietoaineistoja erilaisilla ohjelmistoilla. Kurssin keskiössä on ratkaisujen automatisointi algoritmisen ajattelun keinoin (sarjana hyvin määriteltyjä askeleita), erilaisten ratkaisuvaihtoehtojen identifiointi, analysointi, vertailu ja implementointi (toteutus) tavoitteena löytää tehokas ratkaisu, sekä yleistää ja siirtää ongelmanratkaisuprosessi laajaan joukkoon samankaltaisia laskennallisia ongelmia.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter genomgången kurs kan studenten olika programvaror avsedda för numerisk analys, kan olika sätt att presentera och lagra data, förstår de grundläggande principerna för datoranvändning, t.ex. dess begränsningar och vet hur man analyserar och visualiserar dataset med olika programvaror. Fokus för kursen är automatisering av lösningar med hjälp av algoritmiskt tänkande (som en serie väldefinierade steg), identifiering, analys, jämförelse och implementering av olika lösningsalternativ med syfte att hitta en effektiv lösning, samt generalisera och överföra problemlösningsprocessen till ett brett spektrum av liknande beräkningsproblem.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing this course,, the student knows different software intended for numerical analysis, knows different ways of presenting and storing data, understands the basic principles of computing, e.g. its limitations and knows how to analyze and visualize datasets with different software. The focus of the course is the automation of solutions by means of algorithmic thinking (as a series of well-defined steps), the identification, analysis, comparison and implementation of different solution options with the aim of finding an effective solution, as well as generalizing and transferring the problem-solving process to a wide range of similar computational problems.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan käytännön harjoitustöiden kautta tutkimusdatan käsittelyyn ja visualisointiin erilaisilla ohjelmointi-, täsmä-, ja merkintäkielillä sekä ohjelmistoilla, kuten Python, SQL, MATLAB, Simulink ja HTML5. Tavoitteena on osata organisoida tietoa loogisesti ja muotoilla laskennallisia ongelmia siten, että ne on mahdollista ratkaista tietojenkäsittelytieteiden keinoin sekä tuottaa, esittää ja analysoida tietoa eri abstraktiotasoilla kuten malleina ja simulaatioina.
content.sv: Genom praktiska övningar introducerar kursen bearbetning och visualisering av forskningsdata med hjälp av olika programmerings-, domänspecifika och uppmärkningsspråk och mjukvara som Python, SQL, MATLAB, Simulink och HTML5. Målet är att veta hur man organiserar information logiskt och formulerar beräkningsproblem på ett sådant sätt att det är möjligt att lösa dem med de metoder som vanligtvis används inom datavetenskap och att bearbeta, presentera och analysera information på olika abstraktionsnivåer såsom modeller och simuleringar.
content.en: Through practical exercises, the course introduces the processing and visualization of research data using various programming, domain-spesific, and mark up languages ​​and software such as Python, SQL, MATLAB, Simulink, and HTML5. The goal is to know how to organize information logically and formulate computational problems in such a way that it is possible to solve them using the methods typically used in Computer Science and to process, present and analyze information at different levels of abstraction such as models and simulations.

name.en: Data Structures and Algorithms Y, Lecture

workload.fi: Luento-opetus 24 h, itsenäinen työskentely ja pienryhmäopetus 106 h ja tentti 3 h.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar 24 h, självstudium och undervisning i små grupper 106 h och tentamen3 h.
workload.en: Lectures 24 h, self-study and teaching in small groups 106 h, examination 3 h.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuasi osaat määritellä, vertailla ja toteuttaa perustietorakenteita ja algoritmeja sekä nimetä ja valita niitä esim. hakurakenteiksi, järjestämisongelmaan ja verkon läpikäyntiin. Lisäksi kykenet tunnistamaan ja esittelemään tarkemmin annetun tietorakenteen tai algoritmin sekä osaat antaa esimerkkejä niiden toiminnasta. Pystyt myös keskustelemaan muista keskeisistä tietorakenteista ja algoritmeista käyttäen alan tyypillistä terminologiaa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avklarad kurs klarar du av att definiera, jämföra, samt implementera grundläggande datastrukturer och algoritmer, samt namnge och välja dem t.ex. som sökstrukturer, till sorteringsproblem, och till genomgång av grafer. Dessutom kan du känna igen och närmare beskriva en given datastruktur eller algoritm och kan ge exempel på hur de fungerar. Du kan också diskutera om andra centrala datastrukturer och algoritmer med användning av branschens typiska terminologi.
learningOutcomes.en: Having completed the course, you can define, compare and implement basic data structures and algorithms as well as name and select them, for example, as dictionaries, sorting problem, and graph traversing. In addition, you can identify and describe given data structure or algorithm and give examples of its operation(s). Moreover, you can discuss other essential data structures and algorithms by means of the terminology typically used in this domain.

literature.en: To be announced on course s MyCourses-page.

content.fi: Lineaariset tietorakenteet, puurakenteet ja verkot. Haku- ja järjestämismenetelmiä. Algoritmianalyysin perusteet.
content.sv: Listor, träd och grafer. Metoder för sökning och sortering. Analys av algoritmer.
content.en: Linear data structures, trees and graphs. Searching and sorting methods. Principles of algorithm analysis.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kotitehtävät ja tentti.
assesmentMethods.sv: Hemuppgifter och tentamen.

prerequisites.fi: CS-A1110 Ohjelmointi 1 tai CS-A1111 Ohjelmoinnin peruskurssi Y1.
prerequisites.sv: CS-A1110 Programmering 1 eller CS-A1111 Grundkurs i programmering Y1.
prerequisites.en: CS-A1110 Programming 1 or CS-A1111 Basic Course in Programming Y1.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuasi ymmärrät käsitemallinnuksen merkityksen tiedonhallinnassa ja tunnet yleisimmin käytetyt tietokantojen mallinnus- ja kyselykielet. Osaat suunnitella yksinkertaisia tietokantoja ja tehdä niihin kyselyitä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avklarad kurs förstår du begreppsmodelleringens betydelse i datahanteringoch kan de vanligaste modellerings- och frågespråken för databaser. Du kan planera enkla databaser och göra förfrågningar i dem.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course you understand the role of conceptual modeling in managing data, and know the commonly used database modeling and querying languages. You can design simple databases and write queries.

literature.en: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.
literature.fi: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.
literature.sv: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.

content.fi: Kurssilla käsitellään tiedonhallinnan peruskäsitteitä ja -menetelmiä. Relaatioalgebra, relaatiotietokannat, SQL-kielen käyttö tietokannan määrittelyssä ja käsittelyssä, UML-suunnittelumenetelmä, taulujen normalisointi.
content.sv: Inom kursen granskas grundbegrepp samt metoder för databashantering. I första hand genomgås planering och implementering av databaser med hjälp av den sk. relationsmodellen.
content.en: Basic concepts and methods in database systems. Relational databases: relational algebra, UML-design, normalization and SQL.

assesmentMethods.en: Final examination and an compulsory assignment. Possibility to get extra credits from exercises.

learningOutcomes.fi:
At the end of this course the student should:
    Understand key aspects of human perception and cognition, and how these impact on the design of Human-Computer Interfaces.
    Understand the importance of Human-Computer Interaction in the design of products and services
    Be able to define and describe the key stages of a User Centered Design process
    Understand the key techniques used at each stage of the User Centered Design Process and have practical experience in their application through exercises.
    Be able to compare and contrast qualitative and quantitative evaluation techniques.
    Be able to propose and justify an appropriate evaluation technique to a given problem
    Have awareness of cutting edge interaction research and developments in user interaction paradigms, design and evaluation.
    Have awareness of practical issues in the application of Human-Computer Interaction in an industrial context.
learningOutcomes.sv: At the end of this course the student should:    Understand key aspects of human perception and cognition, and how these impact on the design of Human-Computer Interfaces.    Understand the importance of Human-Computer Interaction in the design of products and services    Be able to define and describe the key stages of a User Centered Design process    Understand the key techniques used at each stage of the User Centered Design Process and have practical experience in their application through exercises.    Be able to compare and contrast qualitative and quantitative evaluation techniques.    Be able to propose and justify an appropriate evaluation technique to a given problem    Have awareness of cutting edge interaction research and developments in user interaction paradigms, design and evaluation.    Have awareness of practical issues in the application of Human-Computer Interaction in an industrial context.

content.fi: As computational systems have moved to become pervasive parts of our lives, it becomes even more important to consider how they can be best designed to be useful and useable by people (or "users"). But what is a "user", how do we understand what they want, and how can we design user interfaces that are effective and efficient for them. This course covers the foundations of Human-Computer Interaction - the study of how computer systems can be designed to support the needs of the people who we intend to use them. The course provides an introduction to UI and UX design, focusing on the user-centered design process as a way of understanding user needs and requirements and testing designs. At a basic level we will cover Usability, User-centered design, prototyping, how this process fits into existing software product development, as well as looking to how the relationship between computers and humans is evolving, and how we might interact with computer systems in the future.

learningOutcomes.fi: After taking the course, students are familiar with the key concepts and abstractions of information security and understand the purpose, function and weaknesses of several security technologies. They are able to model threats and analyze the security of a system critically, from the viewpoint of an attacker. Moreover, they can identify common security flaws in software and apply principles of secure programming.

learningOutcomes.fi: After completing the course, you will be able to: explain the principles behind the implementation of operating systems; discuss abstraction and management of system resoures; describe the typical data structures and algorithms that are commonly employed in operating sytems; experiment with the command line, virtual machines, and software containers; evaluate how to build efficient and dependable systems.

learningOutcomes.fi: You can present and motivate the phases of software engineering (Requirements Engineering, Software Architecture, Software Design and Implementation, Software Testing, Software Evolution) and the main cross-cutting activities of software engineering (Software Processes, Agile Software Development, Configuration Management). You are able to read and understand software engineering literature, and motivate the importance of software engineering.
learningOutcomes.sv: You can present and motivate the phases of software engineering (Requirements Engineering, Software Architecture, Software Design and Implementation, Software Testing, Software Evolution) and the main cross-cutting activities of software engineering (Software Processes, Agile Software Development, Configuration Management). You are able to read and understand software engineering literature, and motivate the importance of software engineering.
learningOutcomes.en: You can present and motivate the phases of software engineering (Requirements Engineering, Software Architecture, Software Design and Implementation, Software Testing, Software Evolution) and the main cross-cutting activities of software engineering (Software Processes, Agile Software Development, Configuration Management). You are able to read and understand software engineering literature, and motivate the importance of software engineering.

content.fi: The course provides a broad but practical view of industrial software development. Students learn the main problems, models and methods of software engineering, including traditional and agile/lean software development. The main software engineering activities, including software requirements engineering, design, implementation, testing and deployment are covered. Supporting workflows, e.g. configuration management and project management are  also discussed. The course is delivered using moodle. Students pass the course by doing one moodle module each week, according to a fixed schedule. Each weekly module consists of a video lecture, a set of readings, a quiz, and a written assignment. After the course, students have a working understanding of software development in industry, and the necessary knowledge and skills to pursue further studies in software engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi: Once you have completed the course you have familiarized yourself with the art of declarative programming with constraint solvers, where the goal is to specify what is to be computed rather than how the actual computation is to take place. You will have an in-depth understanding of central logical representations deployed in the paradigm. Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. You will have a good understanding of some of the main applications of declarative and model-based solution methods, including analysis of discrete systems by state-space search and model-checking. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.
learningOutcomes.sv: Once you have completed the course you have familiarized yourself with the art of declarative programming with constraint solvers, where the goal is to specify what is to be computed rather than how the actual computation is to take place. You will have an in-depth understanding of central logical representations deployed in the paradigm. Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. You will have a good understanding of some of the main applications of declarative and model-based solution methods, including analysis of discrete systems by state-space search and model-checking. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.

You will have an in-depth understanding of central logical representations deployed in the paradigm. Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. You will have a good understanding of some of the main applications of declarative and model-based solution methods, including analysis of discrete systems by state-space search and model-checking. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.

content.fi:
The course covers selected mainstream approaches to declarative programming with constraint solvers, such as Boolean satisfiability (SAT), constraint satisfaction problems (CSP) and satisfiability modulo theories (SMT), as well as some of their most important applications in computer-aided verification and validation of software and hardware systems.
In addition to some of the algorithmic technologies for constraint programming, the course acts as an introduction to declarative and model-based solution of hard computational problems. Application problems are solved by first representing the problem declaratively (as opposed to procedurally) in a high-level modeling language, and then finding one or more solutions by using a general-purpose solver for the high-level modeling language. The declarative models have a semantics separate from the solver algorithms, and the models can be used for multiple purposes and with different types of solver technologies. For example, the same model could be used for control and decision-making, diagnosis, and monitoring.
Specific contents are given on the MyCourses page of the course instance.

In addition to some of the algorithmic technologies for constraint programming, the course acts as an introduction to declarative and model-based solution of hard computational problems. learningOutcomes.fi: Information visualization offers instruments for reasoning about quantitative information, analyzing and communicating statistical information. The course overviews the main typologies of data graphics (data-maps, time-series, space-time narrative, relational diagrams, graphs and methods for dimensionality reduction) and provides a language for discussing data visualizations combined with a knowledge of the human perception of visual objects.
learningOutcomes.sv: Information visualization offers instruments for reasoning about quantitative information, analyzing and communicating statistical information. The course overviews the main typologies of data graphics (data-maps, time-series, space-time narrative, relational diagrams, graphs and methods for dimensionality reduction) and provides a language for discussing data visualizations combined with a knowledge of the human perception of visual objects.
learningOutcomes.en: Information visualization offers instruments for reasoning about quantitative information, analyzing and communicating statistical information. The course overviews the main typologies of data graphics (data-maps, time-series, space-time narrative, relational diagrams, graphs and methods for dimensionality reduction) and provides a language for discussing data visualizations combined with a knowledge of the human perception of visual objects.

content.fi: The course teaches how to visualize information effectively by using the statistical methods, combined with knowledge of the human perception and the basics of data graphics.
content.sv: The course teaches how to visualize information effectively by using the statistical methods, combined with knowledge of the human perception and the basics of data graphics.
content.en: The course teaches how to visualize information effectively by using the statistical methods, combined with knowledge of the human perception and the basics of data graphics.

workload.fi: 1 lecture per week (1h 30 min total each), one computer exercise session per week (1 h 30 min total each), and the rest for studying the course material, doing exercises and preparing for an exam.
workload.sv: 1 lecture per week (1h 30 min total each), one computer exercise session per week (1 h 30 min total each), and the rest for studying the course material, doing exercises and preparing for an exam.
workload.en: 1 lecture per week (1h 30 min total each), one computer exercise session per week (1 h 30 min total each), and the rest for studying the course material, doing exercises and preparing for an exam.

prerequisites.fi: CS-E3210 Machine Learning: Basic Principles'-course or knowledge, skills and experience equivalent to that obtained from completing the course; basic courses in mathematics and probability; Python programming.
prerequisites.sv: CS-E3210 Machine Learning: Basic Principles'-course or knowledge, skills and experience equivalent to that obtained from completing the course; basic courses in mathematics and probability; Python programming.
prerequisites.en: CS-E3210 Machine Learning: Basic Principles'-course or knowledge, skills and experience equivalent to that obtained from completing the course; basic courses in mathematics and probability; Python programming.

learningOutcomes.fi: Understanding of the general principles of deep learning, and the central deep learning methods discussed in the course. After the course, you should be able to apply them to real-world data sets.
learningOutcomes.sv: Understanding of the general principles of deep learning, and the central deep learning methods discussed in the course. After the course, you should be able to apply them to real-world data sets.
learningOutcomes.en: Understanding of the general principles of deep learning, and the central deep learning methods discussed in the course. After the course, you should be able to apply them to real-world data sets.

content.fi: Fundamental and current topics of deep learning. Implementing algorithms on a computer are a part of the course and the programming language is Python. Python-based softwares that allow for symbolic differentiation will also be used.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- esittää lineaariset yhtälöryhmät matriisimuotoisina
- ratkaista matriisimuotoiset yhtälöryhmät Gaussin eliminaatiolla
- suorittaa matriisien peruslaskutoimitukset
- laskea neliömatriisin ominaisarvot
- ymmärtää matriisihajotelmien merkityksen.
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna skriva linjära ekvationssystem i matrisform - kunna  lösa ekvationssystem i matrisform med hjälp av Gausseliminering - kunna utföra aritmetiska operationer med matriser - kunna beräkna egenvärden hos en kvadratisk matris - förstå betydelsen av matrisfaktoriseringar
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student - can write systems of linear equations in matrix form - can solve systems of linear equations in matrix form using Gaussian elimination - can perform basic matrix operations - can compute the eigenvalues of a square matrix - understands the significance of matrix decompositions

content.fi: Vektorkalkyl, matriser och linjära ekvationssystem, egenvärden.
content.sv: Vector computations, matrices and systems of linear equations, eigenvalues.
content.en: Vector computations, matrices and systems of linear equations, eigenvalues.

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710. Yhdessä joko kurssin MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 tai kurssin MS-A04XX Diskreetin matematiikan perusteet kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1110. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta.
substitutes.sv: Tillsammans med kursen MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 ersätter kurser Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710. Tillsammans med kursen MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 eller kursen MS-04XX Grundkurs i diskret matematik ersätter kursen Mat-1.1110. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A00XX Matrisräkning.
substitutes.en:
Together with the course MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1 substitutes the courses Mat-1.1010, Mat-1.1210, Mat-1.1310, Mat-1.1410, Mat-1.1510, Mat-1.1610, Mat-1.1710.
Together with the course MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1 or the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics substitutes the course Mat-1.1110.
Substitutes the courses MS-A00XX Matrix algebra.
